recommendations.title: Was Bobi the World’s Oldest Dog—or a Fraud?
recommendations.excerpt: A quest to uncover the truth about Bobi, named the “oldest dog ever” by Guinness World Records, led to dog fur experts and conspiracy theories, and left me with serious questions about how world records are verified.

recommendations.title: ‘I left the cinema, walked home and announced I was moving’: films that made people emigrate
recommendations.excerpt: If The Lord of the Rings had you yearning for New Zealand, or Julia Roberts on a bike made you fall in love with Bali, you’re not alone. But did you grab your passport and start packing? Meet the people who did.

recommendations.title: The Truth Is Out There: A Father’s Disappearance, Dark Family Secrets, and the Hunt for Bigfoot
recommendations.excerpt: Bruce Champagne stood in a small clearing next to a stump. It was mid-November 2022, and snow was already visible on the nearby mountains. All around Bruce were stands of reeds known as phragmites, some so tall they reached well over his head.

recommendations.title: What is toxic ‘breadcrumbing’? Experts share signs and how to address it
recommendations.excerpt: They love me, they love me not — the phrase sounds like an innocent children’s game. But for some people looking for a relationship in the modern dating scene, a potential partner’s wavering commitment is a painful experience that can leave them torn between feeling hopeful and hopeless.

recommendations.title: ‘Silence can be incredibly hurtful’: How to talk to someone about their chronic illness
recommendations.excerpt: When you have a chronic illness, people say puzzling, vaguely inappropriate things all the time. But despite all the ways people put their proverbial feet in it, the response that bothers me most is silence.
